title: Medieval Europe: Feudalism and Christianity

vocab.definition: Social system based on land ownership and personal loyalty
Self-sufficient estate including lord's residence and peasant villages
Code of conduct for knights emphasizing honor and courtesy
Religious wars between Christians and Muslims for Holy Land
Association of craftsmen or merchants in medieval towns

teachingNotes: Analyze the social hierarchy of feudalism. Discuss the role of the Catholic Church in medieval society and politics.

sample.question: What was the social system based on land ownership and loyalty?

truefalse.question: Chivalry was a code of conduct for knights. (True or False)
Feudalism was based on land ownership and loyalty. (True or False)
A manor was a small apartment. (True or False)
The crusades were religious wars. (True or False)
Guilds were associations of craftsmen. (True or False)
Feudalism had no hierarchy. (True or False)
Crusades were fought for the Holy Land. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What system was based on land and loyalty?

fillintheblank.question: _____ was a social system based on land and loyalty.
_____ was the code of conduct for knights.
The _____ were religious wars for the Holy Land.
A _____ was an association of craftsmen.
Manors included the lord's residence and _____ villages.
Crusades were fought between Christians and _____.

shortanswer.question: What was feudalism?
expectedAny: Social system based on land ownership and personal loyalty
Hierarchical system of lords and vassals

shortanswer.question: What was a manor?
expectedAny: Self-sufficient estate including lord's residence and peasant villages

shortanswer.question: What was chivalry?
expectedAny: Code of conduct for knights emphasizing honor and courtesy

shortanswer.question: What were the crusades?
expectedAny: Religious wars between Christians and Muslims for Holy Land
Military campaigns to control sacred sites

shortanswer.question: What were guilds?
expectedAny: Associations of craftsmen or merchants in medieval towns

shortanswer.question: How did feudalism work?
expectedAny: Lords granted land to vassals in exchange for service and loyalty

shortanswer.question: What was life on a manor?
expectedAny: Self-sufficient agricultural life with lord and peasants

shortanswer.question: Why was chivalry important?
expectedAny: Defined proper knight behavior and honor in society

shortanswer.question: What impact did crusades have?
expectedAny: Increased cultural exchange and trade despite conflict
Brought European contact with Middle East
Mixed religious war with economic effects

shortanswer.question: What did guilds control?
expectedAny: Controlled quality prices training and membership in trades
